programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two (Subtitles) Rating: 9.2

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: Down Under Season 5 Episode 7/10Best friends Tom and Alfie attempt to bring the Australian Outback to the West Midlands, complete with a bug-eating competition and an upside-down set (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 8

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: The Dengineers: Christmas Den A nine-year-old who lives in one of the UK's most famous summer hotspots longs for a Christmas-themed den where she can celebrate her favourite season all year round (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.6

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Blue Peter: Gold Badge Awards Junior Bake Off winner Reece makes a Mother's Day treat (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.1

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Norway Season 4 Episode 4/11Steve Backshall heads to Norway to dive with the orca (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.6

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: South Africa Season 4 Episode 5/11Steve Backshall witnesses a serval hunting in South Africa (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.6

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Pirate Fairy (2014)
programme.desc: A rebellious fairy steals the magic pixie dust that grants her people the power of flight and runs away, becoming captain of a band of pirates. Tinker Bell and her friends set off to recover the dust, but succumb to a spell that switches their magical powers. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Christina Hendricks and Tom Hiddleston (Subtitles)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: South East Asia Season 1 Episode 10/10Monty Don brings his globe-trotting botanical tour to a close with a visit to South-east Asia, where he hopes to witness a true tropical oasis. Visiting the immaculately presented garden of Jim Thompson House in Bangkok, he discovers an exotic plot with a Western flavour. He also meets former president Lee Kuan Yew, who once stated that Singapore should be 'a city in a garden' (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 7.3

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Builders Season 1 Episode 3/6The presenter introduces animals that build structures and adapt the environment for their own benefit, creating safe places to sleep and raise young or traps to catch prey. The programme examines how the huge dams built by beavers can completely transform the surrounding landscape, the function of the different types of silk spiders are capable of producing, and how leafcutter ants build underground gardens where they farm their own food (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 7

programme.title: The Chronicles of Nadiya
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 1/2Part one of two. Documentary following Great British Bake Off winner Nadiya Hussain as she takes a food-inspired journey and returns to her roots in Bangladesh. In the first edition, she travels to her family village near Sylhet in the north east of the country, where she shares her favourite recipes, including baked fish with green mango chutney and thoosha shinni. For a relative's wedding, she bakes a three-tiered pumpkin celebration cake for the bride, and she also takes the opportunity to reconnect with family she has not seen since her arranged marriage over ten years ago (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 5

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw Garden Makeover Season 1 Episode 1/20Chris Beardshaw makes over Susan and Brian Duthie's new-build garden in Cove, Aberdeenshire, transforming their tiny site from the nightmare of rough builder's rubble (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 6.4

programme.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 6/6Mandy and Chris adore their Victorian home in Manchester, but they cannot unlock the potential of their garden. Overlooked on all sides, the couple feel exposed whenever they spend time in it. Providing inspiration for the area are designers Helen Elks-Smith and Pip Probert. Meanwhile, Joel Bird meets Ben and Elaine, a Wiltshire couple who have an unusual outdoor space. Angela Scanlon hosts (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 1.8

programme.title: Up Periscope (1959)
programme.desc: A US Navy frogman is ordered to steal a vital Japanese code book from a Pacific island - but the captain of the submarine entrusted with taking him into enemy waters disapproves of the plan, causing tensions to rise and threatening the mission's success. Second World War adventure, with James Garner, Edmond O'Brien and Alan Hale Jr (Subtitles) Rating: 3.7

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Season 15 Episode 7/60People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 6.6

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 2/3Stacey Dooley helps people answer life-changing questions by examining their DNA. This time, Stacy meets 31-year-old Duri, who fears she may carry a potentially fatal genetic mutation and wants to test her DNA to see if she could suffer from the same disease as her mother. Elsewhere, a woman who was adopted when she was just six-months-old wants to use DNA technology to finally uncover information about her ancestry (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.6

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr Season 2 Episode 6/8As they fight to secure a place in the semi-finals, the four remaining designers are challenged to transform two hair salons in Richmond, London, and for the first time in the competition, the designers will see their spaces before creating their visions. Presenter Alan Carr and judge Michelle Ogundehin will then decide who makes it through to the next stage (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 1.8

programme.title: The 80s with Dominic Sandbrook
programme.desc: The Sound of the Crowd Season 1 Episode 1/3Historian Dominic Sandbrook follows up his 2012 documentary series The 70s by moving on to the following decade. He begins by examining how powerful new forces of choice and consumerism radically reshaped British life - a new culture of consumer-driven populism that propelled Margaret Thatcher to victory. He takes in everything from the popularity of Delia Smith and affordable fashions on the high street, to the subcultures of Britain's youth and the crisis of identity that rocked and splintered the political left (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 3.7

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1980 Documentary exploring the music show's evolution, and the dramatic changes that took place in 1980 when a new generation of British pop arrived, leading to the veteran Top of the Pops orchestra being laid off, and the studio audience doubling in size. Featuring Adam Ant, the Human League, OMD, Kevin Rowland, Sally Lindsay, Kelly Marie, Ray Dorset, Johnny Logan, the Vapors, the Piranhas, and Richard Skinner (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.5

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Rogue Season 18 Episode 14/16Bill Bailey, Jack Carroll and Olga Koch join regular Alan Davies as Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the quiz with a difference, asking questions on the theme of rogue (Subtitles) Rating: 6.5

programme.title: Billie: In Search of Billie Holiday (2020)
programme.desc: A profile of the American jazz singer, capturing her depths and complexity through interviews conducted by journalist Linda Lipnack Kuehl with those who knew her best. With contributions by Charles Mingus, Tony Bennett, Sylvia Syms and Count Basie, as well as her cousin, schoolfriends, lovers, lawyers, pimps and even the FBI agents who arrested her (Subtitles)

programme.title: Whiplash (2014)
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, JK Simmons and Paul Reiser (Subtitles) (Premiere) Rating: 7

programme.title: Jazz Divas Gold
programme.desc: A selection of archive performances by acclaimed female jazz artists from shows including Not So Much a Programme - More a Way of Life, Morecambe and Wise, Parkinson and Show of the Week. Featuring Ella Fitzgerald, Peggy Lee, Blossom Dearie, Nina Simone, Cleo Laine, Marion Montgomery, Betty Carter, Sarah Vaughan, Eartha Kitt and Amy Winehouse (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 3

programme.title: Clouds of Sils Maria (2014)
programme.desc: A famous actress prepares to star in a new production of the play that made her career in a supporting part, with the lead role now played by a scandalous Hollywood star. She and her assistant head to a cottage in the Swiss mountains to prepare, which leads her to reflect on the harsh truths about how her life has changed. Drama, starring Juliette Binoche, Kristen Stewart and Chloe Grace Moretz (Subtitles) Rating: 8.5

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two (Subtitles) Rating: 9.2

programme.title: Alaska: Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: Spring Season 1 Episode 1/3Documentary following the fortunes of humans and animals over the course of a year in Alaska, which is by far the biggest US state and still one of the wildest places on Earth with deep forests and vast mountain ranges. The arrival of spring sees Alaska go through a huge transformation as water, light and warmth return, with animals emerging from hibernation and rushing to cash in on the riches of the season. Dougray Scott narrates (Subtitles) Rating: 10

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Circumnavigation Season 1 Episode 1/5Paul Rose discovers the truth behind the first circumnavigation of the world. More than 500 years ago, Ferdinand Magellan set out to find the riches of the Spice Islands, but contrary to popular perception, he failed to reach them. A dramatic sequence of events followed, involving mutiny and murder, as his scurvy-ridden crew continued the journey without him (Subtitles) Rating: 6.3

programme.title: Man in Room 301
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 5/6Believing that Kalle is in danger, Mikko traces his phone and rushes to a neighbouring island where he finds and accosts Leo. Kalle, who has overheard his uncle's confession, tells Mikko who really killed Tommi. In Finnish Rating: 5.3

programme.title: Man in Room 301
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 6/6Ellu admits to Tytti that he doesn't think that her mother likes him as Daniel drives Anna to their surprise weekend away. In Finnish (New Series) Rating: 5.3

programme.title: Vikings
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 3/3Neil Oliver tells the story of how the age of the Vikings came to an end, using archaeological evidence to explore the lives of the first Danish kings, the spread of Christianity in Scandinavia, and the voyages of discovery undertaken by Norse sailors in the Atlantic. He also profiles Canute, the former king of England, and reveals why the reputation he has accrued over the past millennium does a disservice to his diplomatic feats (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: Glastonbury 2014
programme.desc: Dolly Parton @ Glastonbury 2014 The country singer's complete set on the Pyramid stage at Worthy Farm in the now-traditional legends spot on Sunday afternoon, featuring Jolene, Coat of Many Colours, 9 to 5, Islands in the Stream and I Will Always Love You (Subtitles) Rating: 0.6

programme.title: World's Greatest Treasure Mysteries
programme.desc: Civil War Gold Season 1 Episode 6/Things get dicey when brothers Rick and Marty Lagina send Matty Blake out to the Wild West, where he assists a local treasure hunter with a perilous investigation to uncover the secrets of the missing Civil War gold allegedly hidden by the leader of the defeated US Confederacy, Jefferson Davis Rating: 8.5

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: The Oak Island Curse Season 1 Episode 9/17An exploration of whether a cache of fantastic riches really could have been buried centuries ago on a tiny island in the North Atlantic. For more than 200 years, treasure hunters have been coming to Oak Island in search of a treasure that has so far eluded them all, and has even cost six men their lives. Could it be that, as legend suggests, the treasure is protected by a deadly curse? Rating: 4.3

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Strange Creatures Season 1 Episode 4/17Thousands of people around the world claim to have had encounters with creatures unlike any recognised by mainstream science - such as the mothman, chupacabra and Mongolian death worm. The veteran actor considers whether these incredible beings could actually be real Rating: 4.3

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Life Beyond Death Season 1 Episode 6/17Perhaps the greatest unexplained mystery of all is what happens after death. Clues to the answer may lie in unusual cases of near-death experience, reincarnation, and how memories can be passed from organ donors to transplant recipients. The veteran actor considers if these phenomena are figments of man's collective imagination or whether they could be real Rating: 4.3

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Mysteries of the Mind Season 1 Episode 7/17Even after centuries of study, the human mind remains as inscrutable as ever. Here, the host considers the abilities of the brain, and whether it may be even more powerful than hitherto realised. He also contemplates the notion that remote viewing - the practice of seeking impressions about a distant object using extrasensory perception - will one day become reality Rating: 4.3

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Incredible Survivors Season 1 Episode 8/17An exploration of subjects that have mystified mankind for centuries, with the host shedding light on how the seemingly impossible can sometimes happen. Here, the veteran actor reflects on some remarkable tales of human survival against all the odds. Do such events reveal that humans have a hidden reserve of inexplicable energy locked away that only gets released when the situation calls for it? Rating: 4.3

programme.title: Ancient Discoveries
programme.desc: Mega Ocean Quest Season 6 Episode 11/13Experts discover how an ancient army fought its way through a seven-mile fleet without losing a single ship, and investigate the mystery of a time-travelling vessel. programme.title: Ancient Discoveries
programme.desc: Guns n' Ammo Season 6 Episode 2/13Experts examine a bizarre cannon able to kill tens of men without hitting them, and investigate how a bamboo tube became the first gun. programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Season 17 Episode 4/7Michelle Visage is in the guest announcer booth, Lee Mack is in the studio for a special Mother's Day surprise, Ant and Dec take over a coffee drive-through, Singalong live returns, and there is an all-star sea shanty End of the Show Show. Plus, one lucky viewer receives a Takeaway Getaway as the sky is once again illuminated by the Takeaway Rainbow somewhere in the UK, and a member of the virtual audience gets the chance to Win the Ads (Subtitles) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Season 2021 Episode 11/12Emma Willis hosts the second semi-final, as 12 acts that made it through the blind auditions and the battle rounds compete to impress the judges and win a place in the final. Coaches Anne-Marie, will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs can pick only one act from their teams to progress in the competition, so there are some tough decisions to make. Helping the coaches make those decisions are special guests Melanie C, James Bay, Danny O'Donoghue, and Leigh-Anne Pinnock from Little Mix (Subtitles) Rating: 5.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Season 17 Episode 4/7Michelle Visage is in the guest announcer booth, Lee Mack is in the studio for a special Mother's Day surprise, Ant and Dec take over a coffee drive-through, Singalong live returns, and there is an all-star sea shanty End of the Show Show. Plus, one lucky viewer receives a Takeaway Getaway as the sky is once again illuminated by the Takeaway Rainbow somewhere in the UK, and a member of the virtual audience gets the chance to Win the Ads (Subtitles) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Season 2021 Episode 11/12Emma Willis hosts the second semi-final, as 12 acts that made it through the blind auditions and the battle rounds compete to impress the judges and win a place in the final. Coaches Anne-Marie, will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs can pick only one act from their teams to progress in the competition, so there are some tough decisions to make. Helping the coaches make those decisions are special guests Melanie C, James Bay, Danny O'Donoghue, and Leigh-Anne Pinnock from Little Mix (Subtitles) Rating: 5.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Season 17 Episode 4/7Michelle Visage is in the guest announcer booth, Lee Mack is in the studio for a special Mother's Day surprise, Ant and Dec take over a coffee drive-through, Singalong live returns, and there is an all-star sea shanty End of the Show Show. Plus, one lucky viewer receives a Takeaway Getaway as the sky is once again illuminated by the Takeaway Rainbow somewhere in the UK, and a member of the virtual audience gets the chance to Win the Ads (Subtitles) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Season 2021 Episode 11/12Emma Willis hosts the second semi-final, as 12 acts that made it through the blind auditions and the battle rounds compete to impress the judges and win a place in the final. Coaches Anne-Marie, will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs can pick only one act from their teams to progress in the competition, so there are some tough decisions to make. Helping the coaches make those decisions are special guests Melanie C, James Bay, Danny O'Donoghue, and Leigh-Anne Pinnock from Little Mix (Subtitles) Rating: 5.4

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: Saint-Emilion Season 1 Episode 1/10The chef travels through France to visit the locations that inspired his culinary career, beginning at the Chateau Cheval Blanc in Saint-Emilion, before going back to the kitchens of the Hostellerie de Plaisance, where he worked as a lad more than 30 years ago. programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Season 17 Episode 4/7Michelle Visage is in the guest announcer booth, Lee Mack is in the studio for a special Mother's Day surprise, Ant and Dec take over a coffee drive-through, Singalong live returns, and there is an all-star sea shanty End of the Show Show. Plus, one lucky viewer receives a Takeaway Getaway as the sky is once again illuminated by the Takeaway Rainbow somewhere in the UK, and a member of the virtual audience gets the chance to Win the Ads (Subtitles) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Season 2021 Episode 11/12Emma Willis hosts the second semi-final, as 12 acts that made it through the blind auditions and the battle rounds compete to impress the judges and win a place in the final. Coaches Anne-Marie, will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs can pick only one act from their teams to progress in the competition, so there are some tough decisions to make. Helping the coaches make those decisions are special guests Melanie C, James Bay, Danny O'Donoghue, and Leigh-Anne Pinnock from Little Mix (Subtitles) Rating: 5.4

programme.title: D-Day Sacrifice
programme.desc: The Landings Season 1 Episode 1/2Two-part documentary originally shown to mark the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings and the days of fighting that followed. The first film focuses on the June 6, 1944 landings themselves and begins 24 hours before, as preparations were being finalised for the biggest amphibious fleet in history to free France from the clutches of Nazi Germany. Soldiers, officers and civilians from all sides recall the real-life drama as it unfolded Rating: 6.2

programme.title: D-Day Sacrifice
programme.desc: Battle of Normandy Season 1 Episode 2/2The concluding part of the documentary follows the days of fighting that followed the D-Day landings. As the beaches were secured, French civilians and resistance members gathered around radios to hear news of their liberation. However, the Allied advance to Paris proved slower and more difficult than anticipated and, as the testimony of those involved reveals, Normandy turned out to pay a huge price for its country's freedom Rating: 6.2

programme.title: Building Hitler's Supergun: The Plot to Destroy London
programme.desc: Hugh Hunt examines how the Nazis built the largest cannon in history during the Second World War, a 25-barrelled artillery piece built into a French hillside. He performs a series of experiments to determine how the weapon worked and whether it could have fulfilled its intended purpose - destroying London in its entirety. He also examines plans by the Allies to destroy it, including drone bombers and earthquake-causing weapons Rating: 6.3

programme.title: Nazi Sunken Sub
programme.desc: An investigation into the mysterious disappearance in 1945 of Nazi submarine U-745, whose captain's frozen body was later found off Foglo island in Finland (Subtitles) (Audio Described)

programme.title: Nazi Death Camp: The Great Escape
programme.desc: On October 14, 1943, around 600 Jewish slave labourers attempted to escape the Sobibor death camp in Poland. Although 300 were successful, only 50 lived until the end of the Second World War. Some of the survivors recall their lives as prisoners and their eventual, desperate escape Rating: 10

programme.title: Nazi Attack on America
programme.desc: Documentary about attacks made on American east coast cities and shipping by German submarines, and examining the remains of a sunken U-Boat found near New Orleans

programme.title: Anne Frank: The Nazi Capture
programme.desc: On August 4, 1944, Anne Frank and seven others were found and arrested by the Gestapo. This documentary tells their story from the chilling perspective of their Nazi captors Rating: 10

programme.title: Apocalypse: The Second World War
programme.desc: Apocalypse: The Rise of Hitler Season 2 Episode 1/2Part one of two. Documentary charting the dictator's rise to power, from his beginnings as a struggling artist in Vienna to his eventual demise in Berlin. The first episode focuses on Hitler's formative years and how, when he returned home from the First World War, his nationalistic diatribes were largely ignored by the public, until the 1929 economic crisis put him and his ideas in the spotlight (Subtitles) Rating: 7.8

programme.title: Apocalypse: The Second World War
programme.desc: Apocalypse: The Rise of Hitler Season 2 Episode 2/2Part two of two. Hitler becomes chancellor in 1933 after the German economy collapses and sets out to ensure the Nazi party's members dominate every aspect of society. One year later, he is proclaimed Fuhrer, beginning an ideological and military programme that eventually lead to the invasion of Poland and the start of the Second World War Rating: 7.8

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Norwich Season 2 Episode 19/25Charlie and the Rich brothers try to come up with a contemporary cottage garden design in Norwich to please Jane and Terry, who are unhappy with their existing back garden Rating: 5.8

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Marlborough Season 1 Episode 6/20Charlie Dimmock and Dave and Harry Rich head to Marlborough, Wiltshire, where they come up with ideas to transform a featureless garden into a wildlife haven on a budget of £6,000 Rating: 5.8

programme.title: Britain's Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Roman Chester Season 1 Episode 1/6Alice Roberts explores the UK's past through the stories of its towns, examining key periods in history by delving into the secrets of places that encapsulate them. In the first episode, Alice tells the story of Roman Britain by studying the history of Chester. She enjoys an authentic Roman feast, heads deep underground to check out an extraordinary archaeological find, and explores a radical theory regarding the Romans' plans for Chester Rating: 7.8

programme.title: Britain's Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Viking York Season 1 Episode 2/6Alice Roberts tells the story of Viking England by studying the history of York. She takes part in a Viking battle, meets the metal detectorists behind one of the UK's greatest archaeological finds and gets her hands on an almost 1,000-year-old poo. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson takes to the skies to see how the current layout of York reflects its history Rating: 7.8

programme.title: Britain's Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Norman Winchester Season 1 Episode 3/6Alice Roberts explores the Norman period of British history by examining events that occurred in Winchester, a historic town that still retains many hallmarks of the 11th and 12th centuries. To get a taste of this era, she attempts to storm a castle wearing chain mail, investigates the origins of modern surgery, and tries some eel pie. At the conclusion of the episode, cutting edge CGI is used to take the town back in time, and recreate how it would have looked during this period of British history Rating: 7.8

programme.title: Britain's Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Tudor Norwich Season 1 Episode 4/6Alice Roberts tells the story of Tudor England by studying the history of Norwich, learning the harsh reality of religious intolerance, uncovering the origins of Norwich FC's iconic canary and experiencing humiliating Tudor justice. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson takes to the skies to see how the current layout reflects its history and, at the conclusion of the episode, cutting edge CGI is used to recreate how Norwich would have looked during this period of British history Rating: 7.8

programme.title: Britain's Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Regency Cheltenham Season 1 Episode 5/6Alice Roberts tells the story of the Regency period by studying the history of Cheltenham, Britain's most Regency town. She attends a period society ball, investigates the rigid social hierarchy of the age and explores the Regency fondness for enemas. The penultimate episode of the series in which Alice Roberts studies one key period in history by delving into the secrets of a historic town that encapsulates the era, providing an accurate impression of what life was really like at key moments in the turbulent past Rating: 7.8

programme.title: Britain's Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Victorian Belfast Season 1 Episode 6/6Professor Alice Roberts reveals the history of Belfast, the UK's most Victorian city. She visits the shipyards that built the Titanic, gets locked up in the notorious Crumlin Road gaol and takes a crash course in 19th-century female etiquette. The final episode of this unique take on British history, in which the academic, writer and broadcaster studies one key period in history by delving into the secrets of a historic town that encapsulates the era, providing an impression of what life was really like at key moments in the turbulent past Rating: 7.8

programme.desc: After 116 years at their much-loved Griffin Park, Brentford FC moved to a new stadium. This film look backs at this history with views from the fans to the players Rating: 5

programme.title: Eel Pie Island Hotel
programme.desc: The infamous Eel Pie Island Hotel - tea room, dance hall, music venue and hippy commune. An oral history by the people that played there, visited and lived through those times Rating: 7

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: Railway in Crisis Season 2 Episode 1/4The return of the documentary following the work of the train operating company's staff along the route between London, south-west England and south Wales. The first edition focuses on problems caused by last winter's storms, with the worst weather for a century battering the nation and pushing employees and passengers to the limit. Network Rail's Steve Hawkins and his engineers have their work cut out after the line at Dawlish in Devon is washed away, while Dave Slater and his team at Network Control have to battle the elements to keep trains running as storm after storm floods the network (Subtitles) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: Back on Track Season 2 Episode 2/4As rugby union's Six Nations Championship kicks off in Cardiff, train manager Jodie Edwards and her team try to get thousands of fans home after the match. Penzance in Cornwall remains shut off from the rest of the network as engineers work around the clock to get services running through Dawlish, where the line was washed away, while new duty manager Joe has his hands full on his first Saturday night shift at London's Paddington station when the last Wales-bound train of the evening has a problem (Subtitles) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Trentham Gardens 1 Season 38 Episode 24/26Fiona Bruce presents the show from Trentham Gardens near Stoke-on-Trent, where the experts value a selection of rare finds from the region's historic potteries, as well as a brooch that belonged to flying ace Amy Johnson and a portable road map. Plus, Fiona is challenged to spot the cheap imitation in a collection of gold necklaces (Subtitles) Rating: 5.8

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: Louis XIV Season 1 Episode 3/5The life of Louis XIV, revealing the unpleasant truth behind the grandeur of the Palace of Versailles, and exploring the king's love life and unusual fashion sense (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 10

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: Charles II Season 1 Episode 4/5Tracy Borman explores the decadent Reformation court of Charles II, and uncovers some little-known facts about the king's famous mistress Nell Gwynn (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 10

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: Henry VIII Season 1 Episode 5/5Tracy Borman examines the life of Henry VIII, revealing his physical deterioration in old age and the true story behind his famously short fourth marriage (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 10

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 5/10Tim Dunn follows his family's roots by exploring Metroland, the area around the Metropolitan Railway, and in Great Malvern learns about the woman behind a decorative 1860s station (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 6/10Tim Dunn explores St Pancras station in London and its sister hotel - built to show off the might of the Midlands, and learns about Castle Howard station in North Yorkshire (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Stretched to the Limit Season 1 Episode 1/5David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines two creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world. The chameleon has an extra-long tongue that helps it catch prey and the giraffe's neck is so long it is easily able to reach the tops of trees for food (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.7

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: A Curious Hoax? Season 1 Episode 2/5David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.7

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Young Wrinklies Season 1 Episode 3/5David Attenborough encounters two species with wrinkly skin, where nature has tinkered with the ageing process to different effect. The mole rat retains its looks while growing old and the elephant looks old from birth, yet both creatures live relatively long lives (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.7

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: A Curious Twist Season 1 Episode 4/5David Attend questions why spirals are so widespread in nature. He gleans some answers by examining the narwhal's tusk and the spiral shells found on snails and ammonites, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.7

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Seeing the Pattern Season 1 Episode 5/5David Attenborough examines a zebra's stripes and the wings of a butterfly, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.7

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Virgin Births Season 2 Episode 1/10Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.7

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Armoured Animals Season 2 Episode 2/10Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.7

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Life in the Dark Season 2 Episode 3/10David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.7

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Southampton to Basingstoke Season 5 Episode 11/20Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton, beginning by being taught how to set a table aboard the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth. In the village of Netley he finds the remains of an extensive military hospital built by order of Queen Victoria, and ends his travels in Basingstoke, where he learns out about a pitched battle between townspeople and the Salvation Army (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Winchfield to Crowthorne Season 5 Episode 12/20Michael Portillo travels through Hampshire and Berkshire, as he continues his journey to Wolverhampton. His stop-off points include Stratfield Saye House, the stately home bequeathed by the nation to Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, in 1817. He then heads to Aldershot Garrison, where he is put through his paces under military instruction. At St Michael's Abbey in Farnborough, Michael visits the tomb of French emperor Napoleon III and his family, before ending in Crowthorne, Berkshire, the home of Broadmoor high-security psychiatric hospital (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Wokingham to Bradford on Avon Season 5 Episode 13/20The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. He then learns about a Tudor businessman who manufactured cloth in enormous volumes in Newbury, and ends this leg of his trip in Bradford on Avon, Wiltshire. Here, a local manufacturer describes how his Victorian forebears were the first in Britain to be licensed to vulcanise rubber (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chippenham to Gloucester Season 5 Episode 14/20On the next stage of his journey to Wolverhampton, Michael Portillo visits Lacock Abbey near Chippenham in Wiltshire to find out how the world's first photographic negative was made. He then heads to Bristol Zoo, examines an extraordinary piece of Victorian engineering at Severn Tunnel Junction and ends the leg in Gloucester, where he meets a stonemason at the city's cathedral (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Cheltenham to Wolverhampton Season 5 Episode 15/20On the final leg of his journey from Southampton to the West Midlands, Michael Portillo visits the spa town of Cheltenham, where he gets behind the wheel of a very early locomotive carriage that ran on the road. In Tewkesbury, he joins a group re-enacting a battle from the Wars of the Roses, before he reaches his final destination of Wolverhampton, where he hears how Queen Victoria made an emotional visit that signalled the end of her exile from public life after mourning Prince Albert (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Norwich to Brandon Season 5 Episode 16/20Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The Harder They Fall Season 2 Episode 6/8Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan (Subtitles) Rating: 8.8

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: A Storm in a Teacup Season 3 Episode 1/6Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker (Subtitles) Rating: 8.8

programme.title: Porridge

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties

programme.desc: The Folk Revival Season 1 Episode 4/10Folk performances by artists including Pete Seeger, Tim Buckley, Joan Baez, Bob Dylan and Leonard Cohen (Subtitles) Rating: 8.8

As Booth investigates, he encounters secretive judges and obstructive procedures, so decides to branch out on his own to learn if there's something sinister going on inside the FBI - but the situation takes a dangerous turn. programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: A Curious Hoax? Season 1 Episode 2/5David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.7

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Southampton to Basingstoke Season 5 Episode 11/20Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton, beginning by being taught how to set a table aboard the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth. In the village of Netley he finds the remains of an extensive military hospital built by order of Queen Victoria, and ends his travels in Basingstoke, where he learns out about a pitched battle between townspeople and the Salvation Army (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Winchfield to Crowthorne Season 5 Episode 12/20Michael Portillo travels through Hampshire and Berkshire, as he continues his journey to Wolverhampton. His stop-off points include Stratfield Saye House, the stately home bequeathed by the nation to Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, in 1817. He then heads to Aldershot Garrison, where he is put through his paces under military instruction. At St Michael's Abbey in Farnborough, Michael visits the tomb of French emperor Napoleon III and his family, before ending in Crowthorne, Berkshire, the home of Broadmoor high-security psychiatric hospital (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Wokingham to Bradford on Avon Season 5 Episode 13/20The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. He then learns about a Tudor businessman who manufactured cloth in enormous volumes in Newbury, and ends this leg of his trip in Bradford on Avon, Wiltshire. Here, a local manufacturer describes how his Victorian forebears were the first in Britain to be licensed to vulcanise rubber (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chippenham to Gloucester Season 5 Episode 14/20On the next stage of his journey to Wolverhampton, Michael Portillo visits Lacock Abbey near Chippenham in Wiltshire to find out how the world's first photographic negative was made. He then heads to Bristol Zoo, examines an extraordinary piece of Victorian engineering at Severn Tunnel Junction and ends the leg in Gloucester, where he meets a stonemason at the city's cathedral (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Cheltenham to Wolverhampton Season 5 Episode 15/20On the final leg of his journey from Southampton to the West Midlands, Michael Portillo visits the spa town of Cheltenham, where he gets behind the wheel of a very early locomotive carriage that ran on the road. In Tewkesbury, he joins a group re-enacting a battle from the Wars of the Roses, before he reaches his final destination of Wolverhampton, where he hears how Queen Victoria made an emotional visit that signalled the end of her exile from public life after mourning Prince Albert (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Norwich to Brandon Season 5 Episode 16/20Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping (Subtitles) Rating: 9.3

However, guests Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome have doubts over the cleanliness of their bedroom, and another couple are accustomed to more opulent surroundings (Subtitles) Rating: 5.1

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eden Lodge Season 2011 Episode 2/60Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome hope to impress with their two-star B&B Eden Lodge in Falmouth, Cornwall. However, the state of their property disappoints their fellow competitors. At dinner, James and Maria Church reveal the truth about their famous daughter Charlotte, and the following morning's breakfast reduces some of the guests to fits of giggles (Subtitles) Rating: 5.1

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dexby Townhouse Season 2011 Episode 3/60It is the turn of Charlotte Church's parents James and Maria to play host at Dexby Townhouse in Cardiff, and they pull out all the stops by laying on a day of white-water rafting and a magic performance courtesy of their nephew Elliot. But the following morning, some of the guests are kept waiting for breakfast (Subtitles) Rating: 5.1

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Muddifords Court Country House Season 2011 Episode 4/60Newlyweds Pip Easby and Nicky Lesser-Easby, who run Muddifords Court Country House in Devon, open their doors for the final stay of the competition. The Churches find their four-poster bed too small, and not all the guests enjoy their trip to a local glass-blowing factory, but feedback at check-out time leaves the hosts feeling confident (Subtitles) Rating: 5.1

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment Day Season 2011 Episode 5/60The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Only 20 Rooms to Go Season 3 Episode 1/3Two-and-a-half years have passed since Dick and Angel Strawbridge swapped their flat in Southend for a 19th-century chateau in France costing only £280,000, and in that time, the pair have worked to transform the derelict property into a fairytale castle. However, around half of the 45 rooms are yet to receive adequate attention, the couple's fledgling events business demands attention, and the outbuildings are still in need of conversion (Subtitles) Rating: 7.8

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Season 8 Episode 6/13Tree surgeon David, 27, is airlifted to St George's after falling 40ft to the ground, hitting several branches on his way down and landing head-first onto concrete. Having been knocked unconscious for 10 minutes, the medical team must urgently assess him for internal injuries. Anne, 74, arrives with a sharp pain in her chest, 51-year-old taxi driver Mark receives treatment for a cut on his finger caused by broken glass, and 92-year-old Betty is brought in by ambulance after her carers found her with slurred speech and a shaking hand (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 7.7

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Season 8 Episode 7/13Bob, 51, is airlifted to St George's after falling 20ft from a ladder while repairing his roof. With debris in his wound, doctors are concerned he could develop a life-threatening infection. programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Japan's Tsunami: Caught on Camera Amateur footage and eyewitness accounts telling the story of the earthquake and subsequent tsunami that caused devastation in Japan in March 2011. programme.title: Gangsta Granny
programme.desc: Family comedy based on the children's novel by David Walliams. Schoolboy Ben is bored witless after being made to stay with his grandma. All she ever wants to do is play Scrabble and eat yucky cabbage soup. But it turns out there's a whole lot more to this OAP than cardigans and toffees when she tells him how she used to be an international jewel thief - and when she admits there was one heist she never quite managed in her heyday, the pair set out on a criminal adventure. Julia McKenzie stars as the shady senior citizen, with Walliams and Miranda Hart as the boys' ballroom-dancing parents, alongside Joanna Lumley, Rob Brydon and Robbie Williams, with Reece Buttery as Ben (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.8

programme.title: Louis Theroux - A Place for Paedophiles
programme.desc: The broadcaster reports from Coalinga State Hospital in California, home to more than 500 sex offenders, many of whom have already served lengthy prison sentences and are deemed unsafe for release. During his visit, Louis finds out about a therapy programme run by psychologists who hope to rehabilitate willing participants - but many inmates refuse to take part, with only 13 having completed the course since it began (Audio Described) Rating: 6.5

programme.title: Louis Theroux's LA Stories
programme.desc: City of Dogs Season 1 Episode 1/3The intrepid reporter explores different aspects of Los Angeles, beginning by meeting the characters whose lives revolve around the city's neglected and feral dogs. He goes on patrol with a man on a mission to rescue some of the thousands of stray and ferocious pit bulls roaming the streets and meets hard-pressed staff at LA's largest animal shelter. Louis also encounters training gurus who claim to be able to take the ghetto out of the dog once it has been removed from that environment (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.9

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Role Model Season 23 Episode 29/92CID investigate when a gang of youths carry out a number of audacious daylight robberies, and Emma is stabbed during the undercover operation. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: And Nothing but the Truth Season 23 Episode 30/92Unlucky in love once more, Mickey thumps Heaton for sleeping with Mia and starts packing his bags - though Jack is determined to save his protege's career, even if it means crossing swords with the Superintendent. programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Season 7 Episode 58/150Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes Ian, Eleanor, Stefan and Alison hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot (Subtitles) Rating: 8.7

programme.title: Bob Monkhouse: Million Joke Man
programme.desc: The King of the Game Shows Season 1 Episode 2/3Paul O'Grady presents a retrospective look at the career of comedian Bob Monkhouse, which spanned more than half a century. He reflects on the 1970s and 1980s, when Monkhouse became the undisputed king of the TV game shows, hosting The Golden Shot, Celebrity Squares and Bob's Full House. Featuring rare and often previously unseen archive and contributions from friends (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 5.5

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Naani's Return Season 3 Episode 1/7Return of the sitcom about a British Pakistani family in Sparkhill, Birmingham, whose father sees himself as a pillar of the community - even if nobody else does. Mr Khan is lumbered with looking after his mother-in-law, until a miracle happens - she announces she wants to move into a home. The head of a local care centre arrives, plans are made and Khan is over the moon - until he realises his elderly relative is worth quite a bit of money. Can he stop her leaving after all? Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Maya Sondhi star, with a guest appearance from Sally Lindsay (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 2.3

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The In-Laws Season 3 Episode 2/7With Shazia and Amjad's wedding fast approaching, the Khans invite the Maliks over for dinner, concerned they have never hit it off with the groom's mother - and also hope Amjad's father can help Mr Khan get onto a business committee. They pull out all the stops to impress, with Mrs Khan cooking up a storm in the kitchen, parlour games being organised, Mr Khan buying a new suit, and the couple even having a new piece of furniture to show off. But then an unexpected phone call jeopardises the event. Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor star, with guest appearances by Ted Robbins and Colin McFarlane (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 2.3

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Your Cheating Art Season 4 Episode 5/9Tyler falls into a deep depression after his girlfriend leaves him, spending every hour painting gloomy pictures and starving himself. Marlene enlists Jed and Bryan to help her son mend his broken heart, but when matters do not improve, the responsibility falls to her mother, Dora. Guest starring June Whitfield (Subtitles) Rating: 2.6

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Homesick Season 3 Episode 1/8The run-down state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 7.5

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 7.5

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner

Could it be that, as legend suggests, the treasure is protected by a deadly curse? Rating: 4.3

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner

The veteran actor considers whether these incredible beings could actually be real Rating: 4.3

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Life Beyond Death Season 1 Episode 6/17Perhaps the greatest unexplained mystery of all is what happens after death. Clues to the answer may lie in unusual cases of near-death experience, reincarnation, and how memories can be passed from organ donors to transplant recipients. The veteran actor considers if these phenomena are figments of man's collective imagination or whether they could be real Rating: 4.3

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Mysteries of the Mind Season 1 Episode 7/17Even after centuries of study, the human mind remains as inscrutable as ever. Here, the host considers the abilities of the brain, and whether it may be even more powerful than hitherto realised. He also contemplates the notion that remote viewing - the practice of seeking impressions about a distant object using extrasensory perception - will one day become reality Rating: 4.3

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Incredible Survivors Season 1 Episode 8/17An exploration of subjects that have mystified mankind for centuries, with the host shedding light on how the seemingly impossible can sometimes happen. Do such events reveal that humans have a hidden reserve of inexplicable energy locked away that only gets released when the situation calls for it? Rating: 4.3

The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine Rating: 4.8

programme.title: Jamie Does

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

The Citizens will have been expecting to maintain their excellent form at the expense of struggling Fulham, while the Blues will have hoped to emulate their 3-1 win over Leeds at Stamford Bridge in December. Plus, Crystal Palace v West Bromwich Albion and Everton v Burnley (Subtitles) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: Eagle Eye (2008)
programme.desc: Two strangers find themselves on the run from the authorities when they receive mysterious phone calls informing them their lives are in danger. They are forced to follow the instructions of a woman who is tracking their every move, while at the same time trying to discover who is behind the conspiracy. Thriller, starring Shia LaBeouf, Michelle Monaghan, Rosario Dawson and Michael Chiklis (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 6.9

programme.desc: 13/03/2021 (Subtitles) Rating: 6.8

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Season 4 Episode 11/James serves up a feast of fantastic food for actress Catherine Tyldesley, who will be discussing her new ITV drama Viewpoint. Recipes for seabass, and chicken and potato cakes are on the menu, there is a Mother's Day-inspired Masterclass, and chefs Atul Kochhar and Francesco Mazzei serve up some dishes of their own (Subtitles) Rating: 1.9

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: Raymond's Travels Season 1 Episode 7/Raymond shares his love of travel and embracing the influence of other cultures into his cuisine, including a fresh flash-fired squid with fennel and rocket salad, and a miso and harissa aubergine with cous cous. Plus, chef and good friend José Pizarro visits and indulges Raymond with a dish of pan-fried salted cod with chickpeas, white beans and spinach stew (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 7.5

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: Saint-Emilion Season 1 Episode 1/10The chef travels through France to visit the locations that inspired his culinary career, beginning at the Chateau Cheval Blanc in Saint-Emilion, before going back to the kitchens of the Hostellerie de Plaisance, where he worked as a lad more than 30 years ago. He rounds off his trip by cooking at an award-winning vineyard (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 2

programme.desc: (Subtitles) Rating: 6.9

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Season 17 Episode 4/7Michelle Visage is in the guest announcer booth, Lee Mack is in the studio for a special Mother's Day surprise, Ant and Dec take over a coffee drive-through, Singalong live returns, and there is an all-star sea shanty End of the Show Show. Plus, one lucky viewer receives a Takeaway Getaway as the sky is once again illuminated by the Takeaway Rainbow somewhere in the UK, and a member of the virtual audience gets the chance to Win the Ads (Subtitles) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Season 2021 Episode 11/12Emma Willis hosts the second semi-final, as 12 acts that made it through the blind auditions and the battle rounds compete to impress the judges and win a place in the final. Coaches Anne-Marie, will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs can pick only one act from their teams to progress in the competition, so there are some tough decisions to make. Helping the coaches make those decisions are special guests Melanie C, James Bay, Danny O'Donoghue, and Leigh-Anne Pinnock from Little Mix (Subtitles) Rating: 5.4

programme.desc: A courier is kidnapped and forced to become a drug mule. programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Season 17 Episode 4/7Michelle Visage is in the guest announcer booth, Lee Mack is in the studio for a special Mother's Day surprise, Ant and Dec take over a coffee drive-through, Singalong live returns, and there is an all-star sea shanty End of the Show Show. Plus, one lucky viewer receives a Takeaway Getaway as the sky is once again illuminated by the Takeaway Rainbow somewhere in the UK, and a member of the virtual audience gets the chance to Win the Ads (Subtitles) Rating: 8.2

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Season 2021 Episode 11/12Emma Willis hosts the second semi-final, as 12 acts that made it through the blind auditions and the battle rounds compete to impress the judges and win a place in the final. Coaches Anne-Marie, will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs can pick only one act from their teams to progress in the competition, so there are some tough decisions to make. Helping the coaches make those decisions are special guests Melanie C, James Bay, Danny O'Donoghue, and Leigh-Anne Pinnock from Little Mix (Subtitles) Rating: 5.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay (Subtitles) Rating: 8.4

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Season 2021 Episode 11/12Emma Willis hosts the second semi-final, as 12 acts that made it through the blind auditions and the battle rounds compete to impress the judges and win a place in the final. programme.title: Urban Secrets

programme.title: Urban Secrets

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Grand Union Canal Season 1 Episode 1/3Dan Jones examines Britain's most iconic canals, beginning with the 152-mile Grand Union Canal, which runs up the spine of the country. Constructed at the height of the Industrial Revolution, the task challenged even the greatest engineering minds of the time, including pioneers such as James Brindley, the man behind Britain's first commercial canal, and William Jessop, the person with whom responsibility lay for the building of the main link from Birmingham to London. Travelling along its route, Dan experiences first-hand the innovations behind its construction, including the Blisworth tunnel (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Sign Language) Rating: 8.6

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Susan Calman's Grand Day Out on the Lakes Season 1 Episode 2/6The comedian aboard her vintage camper van, explores the mountainous region of north-west England and the Lake District. She begins her 142-mile journey just south of Penrith, travelling down through the lakes, before heading west to finish near Keswick. Along the way she meets the people and visits the places that make this most scenic part of Britain unique. On Ullswater, Susan gets a chance to take charge of the oldest working passenger vessel in the world, the Lady of the Lake. Then she hears of Beatrix Potter's love of the region before heading the spooky Muncaster Castle (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 6.3

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Leeds and Liverpool Canal Season 1 Episode 2/3Writer and historian Dan Jones navigates Britain's longest canal to be built by just one company, the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Built to link the economically booming counties of Yorkshire and Lancashire, this 19th-century superhighway was experimental for the time, and made Liverpool the busiest port in the world. In Burnley, the cotton capital of the 19th century, Dan visits the world's only steam-powered cotton mill, where enough cloth was woven each year to reach to the moon and back two-and-a-half times (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Sign Language) Rating: 8.6

programme.title: Attenborough's Life in Colour
programme.desc: Hiding in Colour Season 1 Episode 2/2David Attenborough reveals the extraordinary ways that some animals use colour to hide and disappear into the background. The Bengal tigers of central India use their striped patterns to dazzle colour blind prey, while zebras on the Masai Mara use motion dazzle to confuse predators. Other animals use colour to trick and to deceive. On Australia's Great Barrier Reef, a blue-striped blenny uses colours to mimic other fish and launch a sudden attack (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 5.7

The Bengal tigers of central India use their striped patterns to dazzle colour blind prey, while zebras on the Masai Mara use motion dazzle to confuse predators. Other animals use colour to trick and to deceive. On Australia's Great Barrier Reef, a blue-striped blenny uses colours to mimic other fish and launch a sudden attack (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 5.7

programme.title: The Story of China
programme.desc: Ancestors Season 1 Episode 1/6Michael Wood tells the story of the world's newest superpower, exploring the stories, people, culture and landscapes that have helped create its character over 4,000 years. He begins by looking at ancestry, one of the great themes of Chinese history. He joins a 300-strong family as they reunite to carry out rituals for an ancestor who died in 1049, witnesses a million pilgrims at the shrine of the goddess Nu Wa, and hears about China's greatest archaeological discovery, the Oracle Bones, which reveal fascinating clues about the first great dynasty - the Shang (Subtitles) Rating: 5.6

programme.title: The Story of China
programme.desc: Silk Roads & China Ships Season 1 Episode 2/6Michael Wood tells the story of China's first great international age under the Tang Dynasty (618-907). He travels along the Silk Road to the bazaars of Central Asia, and into India on the track of the monk who brought Buddhism back to China. In Xi'an, he talks to Chinese Muslims in the Great Mosque and hears the story of the first reception of Christianity in 635. Moving south, he finds out about the beginnings of China as an economic giant, witnesses a lock on the Grand Canal that was built in 605 but still handles 800 barges a day, and tracks the rise of both silk and tea (Subtitles) Rating: 5.6

programme.title: The Story of China
programme.desc: The Golden Age Season 1 Episode 3/6Michael Wood finds out about China's most creative dynasty, the Song (960-1279). In the city of Kaifeng, he hears the legend of the baby boys who became emperors, then explores the ideas and inventions that made the Song one of greatest eras in world culture. A chef cooks a recipe from a Song cookbook, local women talk about the 1085 volume How To Live Happy Healthy Lives for Old People - which is still in print - and Michael steers a huge working replica of an astronomical clock, made by China's answer to Leonardo da Vinci (Subtitles) Rating: 5.6

programme.title: The Story of China
programme.desc: The Ming Season 1 Episode 4/6Michael Wood tells the story of the Ming dynasty, founded by peasant rebel Zhu Yuanzhang, who fought his way up to become the Hongwu emperor. The film explores the importance of architecture to the Ming, visiting the emperor's capital of Nanjing, with its 21 miles of massive walls. Following the trail, Michael goes to the Bao family village and sees the locals act a Ming murder story, before hearing about voyages to Africa and the Gulf decades before Columbus, and learning about the silk industry, ceramics and lacquer-making (Subtitles) Rating: 5.6

programme.title: The Story of China
programme.desc: The Last Empire Season 1 Episode 5/6Michael Wood tells the story of the Qing, China's last empire, which lasted from 1644 till 1911, doubled the size of the country by including Xinjiang, Mongolia and Tibet, and tolerated a diversity of cultures and religions, including Islam. Michael explores the Qing's heritage with visits to a women's mosque, storytelling houses and a traditional printing house to see how all 48,000 Tang Poems were reproduced using hand-carved wood blocks. He also joins audiences to watch open-air opera in the snow and hears about the first Opium War, when a British expedition destroyed the Qing navy and extracted territory and trading rights (Subtitles) Rating: 5.6

programme.title: The Story of China
programme.desc: The Age of Revolution Season 1 Episode 6/6Michael Wood's exploration of the history of China concludes with the impact of its revolutions, of which there were three between 1850 and 1950. Michael heads into the wild mountain villages in the south of the country where the Taiping Rebellion began and lasted from 1850 to 1864, fought between the established Manchu-led Qing dynasty and the Heavenly Kingdom of Peace, led by Hong Xiuquan. The Boxer Rebellion at the turn of the 20th century developed against the disruption caused by the growth of foreign spheres of influence in China, while Michael talks to a survivor of the Nanjing Massacre, when Japanese troops took over the city in 1937 (Subtitles) Rating: 5.6

programme.title: I Can't Say My Name: Stammering in the Spotlight
programme.desc: BBC producer Felicity Baker has a stammer that she has spent her whole life trying to hide. She struggles to say her own name. Now she is stepping out in front of the camera for the first time to talk about what it is like to live with the condition - and she soon finds she is not alone. She meets a rugby player who blames his stammer for his aggressive behaviour on the pitch, a rapper who found music stopped him stammering and the comedy star Michael Palin, whose father stammered but never ever spoke about it (Subtitles)
